definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: New words are created, and some old words develop new meanings.
sentences.chinese: 新字被创造出来，而一些旧字衍生新字义。

sentences.english: The two words are identical in meaning.
sentences.chinese: 这两个字的字义完全一样。

sentences.english: He writes "Mengzi Ziyi Shuzheng" in expectation of rebuilding study of Mencius.
sentences.chinese: 他作《孟子字义疏证》，以重建孟学原貌自期。

sentences.english: The dictionary gives us a wealth of phrases and sentences to illustrate meaning.
sentences.chinese: 这本词典给了我们许多说明字义的词组和句子。

sentences.english: Literally , it means pavilion beyond pavilion A famous restaurant in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 照字义，意思是楼外还有楼，是南京一家著名的宾馆。

sentences.english: Illustration is often more useful than definition for giving the meanings of words.
sentences.chinese: 在给字义时，举例常比下定义更有用。

sentences.english: Try to guess from the context.
sentences.chinese: 请试著从上下文猜测字义。

sentences.english: The semantic function of Chinese morphemes is embodied in the component units of word meaning.
sentences.chinese: 汉字义符的示意作用体现在字义组成单位中。
是英文字义“除去补色”的简称。

definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
original form of a Chinese character
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
